title: How to Make Tropical, High Protein, Grain Free Cake

steps.headline: Create a "grain-free lifestyle" without sacrificing variety, nutrition, or taste by cutting out all "grass seed", i.e.
Grate coarsely or chop chocolate squares.
Drain the canned fruits and the garbanzos.
Grate, chop or puree (grind finely) the fruits and the garbanzos (also called chick peas).
steps.description: These are mildly flavored comparable to soy beans.

steps.headline: Partially dry the ground or pureed ingredients, if desired, by blotting, or by storing them in the refrigerator, covered by a fabric (for a day or so).
steps.description: Otherwise, expect a very moist cake. Without gluten and sugar it will have only a little natural stickiness/cohesion, eggs and fruits help give what sticky quality there is.

steps.headline: Whisk or whip eggs/egg whites.
steps.description: Without eggs, the cake may be unable to firm up.

steps.headline: Combine ingredients in a large bowl and fold-in whipped eggs.
steps.description: Save back the nuts to sprinkle on top.

steps.headline: Grease pan.
steps.description: Sprinkle pan with protein powder (or ground-up oats, milk powder, or a flour as desired).

steps.headline: Bake in middle of oven for firming up without scorching the top or bottom.
steps.description: Bake in 375F oven, for 45 minutes approximately. If the batter seems juicier, use a longer baking time (or if starting off less juicy, use shorter time).

steps.headline: Check whether the cake is done by sticking in a toothpick and pulling it out.
steps.description: If it stays "clean"/rather dry, then it is done.

text: Create a "grain-free lifestyle" without sacrificing variety, nutrition, or taste by cutting out all "grass seed", i.e. : grain, products. Preheat the oven to 375F degrees.  Grate coarsely or chop chocolate squares.  Drain the canned fruits and the garbanzos.  Grate, chop or puree (grind finely) the fruits and the garbanzos (also called chick peas). These are mildly flavored comparable to soy beans. Partially dry the ground or pureed ingredients, if desired, by blotting, or by storing them in the refrigerator, covered by a fabric (for a day or so). Otherwise, expect a very moist cake. Without gluten and sugar it will have only a little natural stickiness/cohesion, eggs and fruits help give what sticky quality there is. Whisk or whip eggs/egg whites. Without eggs, the cake may be unable to firm up. Combine ingredients in a large bowl and fold-in whipped eggs. Save back the nuts to sprinkle on top. Grease pan. Sprinkle pan with protein powder (or ground-up oats, milk powder, or a flour as desired). Bake in middle of oven for firming up without scorching the top or bottom. Bake in 375F oven, for 45 minutes approximately. If the batter seems juicier, use a longer baking time (or if starting off less juicy, use shorter time). Check whether the cake is done by sticking in a toothpick and pulling it out. If it stays "clean"/rather dry, then it is done. Finished.
